TextView.android:text:
CFR 
CFR decompiles modern Java features - Java 8 lambdas (pre and post Java beta 103 changes), Java 7 String switches etc. 
License: http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT 
http://www.benf.org/other/cfr 
 
JADX 
JADX is a Dex to Java decompiler. 
License: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
https://github.com/skylot/jadx 
 
Fernflower 
Fernflower is the first actually working analytical decompiler for Java and probably for a high-level programming language in general 
License: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/tree/master/plugins/java-decompiler/engine 
 
Lucene 
Apache Lucene is a free and open-source information retrieval software library, originally written in 100% pure Java by Doug Cutting. It is supported by the Apache Software Foundation and is released under the Apache Software License. 
License: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
http://lucene.apache.org/ 
 
elFinder 
elFinder is an open-source full feature file manager for web apps, written in JavaScript using jQuery UI. Creation is inspired by simplicity and convenience of Finder program used in Mac OS X operating system. 
License: https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause 
 
BOOTSTRAP 
Bootstrap is the front end adaptive framework that enables the web app to look great in all sorts of small and large web browsers. 
No modifications are made to this library. 
License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ 
 
GLYPHICONS 
Icons are provided by GLYPHICONS.com as distributed with Bootstrap. 
No modifications are made to this library. 
License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ 
 
COMMONS CODEC 
The Apache Commons Codec package contains simple encoder and decoders for various formats such as Base64 and Hexadecimal. In addition to these widely used encoders and decoders, the codec package also maintains a collection of phonetic encoding utilities. 
No modifications are made to this library. 
License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/ 
 
GUAVA Google Core Libraries 
The Guava project contains several of Google's core libraries that we rely on in our Java-based projects: collections, caching, primitives support, concurrency libraries, common annotations, string processing, I/O, and so forth. 
No modifications are made to this library. 
License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 
 
JACKSON 
Jackson is a suite of data-processing tools for Java (and JVM platform), including the flagship JSON parsing and generation library. 
No modifications are made to this library. 
License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
